newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: WOLTERS SHARES SOFTEN AFTER H1 RESULTS.
newsitem.headline: WOLTERS SHARES SOFTEN AFTER H1 RESULTS.

text.p: Shares of Dutch publisher Wolters Kluwer NV retreated slightly in Amsterdam on Tuesday after the firm reported first-half net profits of 244 million guilders, in line with analysts' estimates.

The shares initially lost more ground, then recovered slightly after the group said it saw full-year fully-diluted EPS up around 19.5 percent to 8.40 guilders. The company had forecast annual growth of EPS of at least 15 percent.
At 0951 GMT, Wolters Kluwer shares stood down 2.00 guilders at 281.00.
